AttachmentConfig.description: Represents a config to handle a certain GMail attachment

actions.description: The list actions to be executed for their respective handler scopes
actions.title: actions

description.description: The description of the attachment handler config
description.title: description

match.description: Specifies which attachments match for further processing
match.title: match

name.description: The unique name of the attachment config (will be generated if not set)
name.title: name

AttachmentConfig.title: AttachmentConfig

level.description: The level of the log message (default: `info`).
level.title: level

level.description: The level of the log message (default: `info`).
level.title: level

level.description: The level of the log message (default: `info`).
level.title: level

to.description: The recipient of the forwarded message.
to.title: to

docsFileLocation.description:
The location of the (temporary) Google Docs file containing the extracted OCR text, in case it should be stored in addition to further processing.
Supports placeholder substitution.
Default: (unset)
docsFileLocation.title: docsFileLocation

extract.description:
A regular expression that defines which values should be extracted.
It is recommended to use the named group syntax `(?<name>...)` to reference the extracted values using names like `${attachment.extracted.name}`.
extract.title: extract

language.description:
Hints at the language to use for OCR. Valid values are BCP 47 codes.
Default: (unset, auto-detects the language)
language.title: language

conflictStrategy.description: The strategy to be used in case a file already exists at the desired location.
conflictStrategy.title: conflictStrategy

description.description:
The description to be attached to the Google Drive file.
Supports placeholder substitution.
description.title: description

location.description:
The location (path + filename) of the Google Drive file.
For shared folders or Team Drives prepend the location with the folder ID like `{id:<folderId>}/...`.
Supports placeholder substitution.
location.title: location

toMimeType.description: Convert to a Google file type using one of the supported mime-types by Google Drive, like: * `application/vnd.google-apps.document`: Google Docs * `application/vnd.google-apps.presentation`: Google Slides * `application/vnd.google-apps.spreadsheet`: Google Sheets
toMimeType.title: toMimeType

AttachmentMatchConfig.description: Represents a config to match a certain GMail attachment

contentType.description: A RegEx matching the content type of the attachment
contentType.title: contentType

includeAttachments.description: Should regular attachments be included in attachment processing (default: true)
includeAttachments.title: includeAttachments

includeInlineImages.description: Should inline images be included in attachment processing (default: true)
includeInlineImages.title: includeInlineImages

largerThan.description:
Only include attachments larger than the given size in bytes.
Set to `-1` to ignore it.
largerThan.title: largerThan

name.description: A RegEx matching the name of the attachment
name.title: name

smallerThan.description:
Only include attachments smaller than the given size in bytes.
Set to `-1` to ignore it.
smallerThan.title: smallerThan

AttachmentMatchConfig.title: AttachmentMatchConfig

ConflictStrategy.description: Strategy that defines how to deal in case of conflicts with already existing files at the desired location in Google Drive.
ConflictStrategy.title: ConflictStrategy

GlobalConfig.description: The global configuration defines matching and actions for all threads, messages or attachments.

attachment.description: The global attachment config affecting each attachment.
attachment.title: attachment

message.description: The global message config affecting each message.
message.title: message

thread.description: The list of global thread affecting each thread.
thread.title: thread

variables.description: A list of variable entries to be used in substitutions to simplify configurations.
variables.title: variables

GlobalConfig.title: GlobalConfig

contextValue.description: The context-dependent value. It allows different values depending on the context type.
contextValue.title: contextValue

name.description: The name of the log field that can be referenced from the list of log fields.
name.title: name

title.description: The title of the log field that is used as the headline of the log sheet.
title.title: title

value.description: The value of the log field. Supports placeholder substitution.
value.title: value

attachment.description: The value to be used for attachment context. Supports placeholder substitution.
attachment.title: attachment

env.description: The value to be used for environment context. Supports placeholder substitution.
env.title: env

message.description: The value to be used for message context. Supports placeholder substitution.
message.title: message

proc.description: The value to be used for processing context. Supports placeholder substitution.
proc.title: proc

thread.description: The value to be used for thread context. Supports placeholder substitution.
thread.title: thread

The description to be attached to the Google Drive file.
Supports placeholder substitution.

headers.description:
The header to pass to the URL. May be used to pass an authentication token.
Supports placeholder substitution.
headers.title: headers

location.description:
The location (path + filename) of the Google Drive file.
For shared folders or Team Drives prepend the location with the folder ID like `{id:<folderId>}/...`.
Supports placeholder substitution.
location.title: location

toMimeType.description: Convert to a Google file type using one of the supported mime-types by Google Drive, like: * `application/vnd.google-apps.document`: Google Docs * `application/vnd.google-apps.presentation`: Google Slides * `application/vnd.google-apps.spreadsheet`: Google Sheets
toMimeType.title: toMimeType

url.description:
The URL of the document to be stored.
To extract the URL from the message body use a message body matcher like `"(?<url>https://...)"` and `"${message.body.match.url}"` as the URL value.
NOTE: Take care to narrow down the regex as good as possible to extract valid URLs.
Use tools like [regex101.com](https://regex101.com) for testing on example messages.
url.title: url

MessageConfig.description: Represents a config to handle a certain GMail message

actions.description: The list actions to be executed for their respective handler scopes
actions.title: actions

attachments.description: The list of handler that define the way attachments are processed
attachments.title: attachments

description.description: The description of the message handler config
description.title: description

match.description: Specifies which attachments match for further processing
match.title: match

name.description: The unique name of the message config (will be generated if not set)
name.title: name

MessageConfig.title: MessageConfig

level.description: The level of the log message (default: `info`).
level.title: level

level.description: The level of the log message (default: `info`).
level.title: level

level.description: The level of the log message (default: `info`).
level.title: level

to.description: The recipient of the forwarded message.
to.title: to

MessageFlag.description: A flag to match messages with certain properties.
MessageFlag.title: MessageFlag

MessageMatchConfig.description: Represents a config to match a certain GMail message

body.description:
A RegEx matching the body of messages.
Use `(?s)` at the beginning of the regex if you want `.` to match a newline.
body.title: body

from.description: A RegEx matching the sender email address of messages
from.title: from

is.description: A list of properties matching messages should have
is.title: is

newerThan.description: An RFC 3339 date/time format matching messages older than the given date/time
newerThan.title: newerThan

olderThan.description: An RFC 3339 date/time format matching messages older than the given date/time
olderThan.title: olderThan

plainBody.description:
A RegEx matching the plain body of messages.
Use `(?s)` at the beginning of the regex if you want `.` to match a newline.
plainBody.title: plainBody

subject.description: A RegEx matching the subject of messages
subject.title: subject

to.description: A RegEx matching the recipient email address of messages
to.title: to

MessageMatchConfig.title: MessageMatchConfig

SettingsConfig.description: Represents a settings config that affect the way GmailProcessor works.

defaultArrayJoinSeparator.description: Default separator to be used when joining arrays in string substitution.
defaultArrayJoinSeparator.title: defaultArrayJoinSeparator

defaultTimestampFormat.description:
Default format string for timestamp formatting.
See [date-fns format strings](https://date-fns.org/docs/format).
defaultTimestampFormat.title: defaultTimestampFormat

logConfig.description: Defines additional fields that can be used in addition to the built-in ones for log sheet logging.
logConfig.title: logConfig

logFields.description:
The list of field names to be used for log sheet logging.
All context placeholder names can be referenced as well as special fields defined for logging.
logFields.title: logFields

logSheetLocation.description:
Location of the spreadsheet log file. Enables logging to a spreadsheet if not empty.
Example: `GmailProcessor/logsheet-${date.now:date::yyyy-MM}`
logSheetLocation.title: logSheetLocation

markProcessedLabel.description: The label to be added to processed GMail threads (only for markProcessedMode="label").
markProcessedLabel.title: markProcessedLabel

markProcessedMethod.description: The method to mark processed threads/messages.
markProcessedMethod.title: markProcessedMethod

maxBatchSize.description: The maximum batch size of threads to process in a single run to respect Google processing limits
maxBatchSize.title: maxBatchSize

maxRuntime.description: The maximum runtime in seconds for a single run to respect Google processing limits
maxRuntime.title: maxRuntime

sleepTimeAttachments.description: The sleep time in milliseconds between processing each attachment
sleepTimeAttachments.title: sleepTimeAttachments

sleepTimeMessages.description: The sleep time in milliseconds between processing each message
sleepTimeMessages.title: sleepTimeMessages

sleepTimeThreads.description: The sleep time in milliseconds between processing each thread
sleepTimeThreads.title: sleepTimeThreads

timezone.description: The timezone to be used for date/time operations. Value `default` uses the script timezone.
timezone.title: timezone

ThreadMatchConfig.description: Represents a config to match a certain GMail thread

labels.description: The regex to match at least one label
labels.title: labels

maxMessageCount.description:
The maximum number of messages a matching thread is allowed to have.
Set to `-1` to ignore it.
maxMessageCount.title: maxMessageCount

minMessageCount.description:
The minimum number of messages a matching thread must have.
Set to `-1` to ignore it.
minMessageCount.title: minMessageCount

query.description:
The GMail search query additional to the global query to find threads to be processed.
See [Search operators you can use with Gmail](https://support.google.com/mail/answer/7190?hl=en) for more information.
query.title: query

messages.description: The list of handler that define the way nested messages or attachments are processed
